intro: Bicornella rolfei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its rosette of velvety, waxy leaves and produces clusters of showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Bicornella rolfei is prized for its compact growth habit and long-lasting blooms.
